result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Phillip Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Phillip Williams in court.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic in court for James Phillip Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense has discovery and is awaiting an offer. Defense requests motion hearing date. Case scheduled for status conference, BR 01.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Phillip Williams appeared by video.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Defendant may be public defender eligible.  Court ordered defendant to contact the SPD office to see if he qualifies. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/2/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant James Phillip Williams in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/31/22 @ 2:30p
